SEARCH
Module iu.util.type
Package edu.iu.type

Interface IuComponent

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable
public interface IuComponent extends AutoCloseable
Application component facade interface.

A component is defined by one or more Java Archive (jar) files. In addition to operating as a element in a class and/or module path, application components are strictly validated and loaded into an isolated context.

Class Loading

See ClassLoader. IuComponent is intended for use as a bootstrap utility that shields loaded components from class loading and type introspection details. Therefore, application modules loaded using this interface must not have access to the iu.util.type module that loaded the component or any of its transitive dependencies.

Modular components are loaded with an isolated ModuleLayer that must not delegate to any non-platform modules.

Legacy components are loaded with an isolated ClassLoader that must not delegate to the system class loader.

Modular Components

The common-case component type for IU Java Utilities is a Modular Component. This format has strong parity with and must meet all requirements of the Java Module System.

Each modular component must:

  • Meet all component packaging requirements outlined in JEE 10 Section 8
  • Seal all packages
  • Include a module descriptor (module-info.class) for each element in its path.
  • If the module descriptor is missing from the first element in the path, the of(Path...) method will attempt to load it as a legacy component.
  • If the module descriptor is missing from any subsequent path element, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

Modular components should:

  • Enumerate dependencies required on the class in the Extension-List manifest attribute. When present, the extension list will be enforced. This is not required, however, since a module descriptor must be present.
  • Include the following manifest attributes when intended for use as a dependency. These attributes must be present when a dependent component lists the modular component in its extension list.
    • Extension-Name
    • Implementation-Version

Modular components may:

  • Embed dependencies. When embedding, the modular component:
    • Must list each embedded dependency in the Class-Path manifest attribute
    • Should embed dependencies in the META-INF/lib/ folder.

All dependencies of modular must meet all requirements listed above for modular components.

Legacy Component

A component should be modular. However, when the component is unable to meet the requirements outlined above, for example because adding a module descriptor would introduce breaking changes, it may be loaded as an legacy component.

IU JEE 6 Compatibility

The primary purpose of the legacy component type is to support application components developed for IU JEE 6.

Web Component

A component may be defined as a Web Application Archive

Each web component must meet all requirements listed above for either modular or legacy components. A web component must not be listed as a dependency and should not include the Extension-Name or Specification-Version manifest attributes.

Web components may only embed dependencies in the WEB-INF/lib/ folder, and should not include the Class-Path manifest attribute.

Remotable Types

The introspection methods on this interface only return remotable types.

Remotable types...

  • must include the public modifier.
  • must not enclosed by another type, a constructor, or a method.
  • loaded by a modular component must be in a package that is unconditionally open by a module in the component's path.
  • loaded by a unnamed component must be defined by a path entry that also includes a resource named META-INF/iu.properties.
  • must not be in a package or module that starts with
    • jakarta
    • java
    • javax
    • jdk
    • com.sun
  • must be opened by a module whose name is included in the comma-separated value associated with the property named remotableModules, when defined by the META-INF/iu-type.properties resource in the first element in a modular component's path. If the component is unnamed or this property is not defined, then all type meeting the criteria outlined above are considered remotable.

Unsupported Component Formats

Support for the formats outlined in this section are out of scope and will result in IllegalArgumentException when passed to of(Path...).

Enterprise Application Archives

An Enterprise Application Archive (ear) file contains components. The IU JEE 7 Enterprise Archive implementation will consume this interface to compose applications, but an ear file is not itself a component. An ear file must not be supplied to the of(Path...) method.

Resource Adapter Archives

An Resource Adapter Archive (rar) file contains Java and non-Java components. The IU JEE 7 Resource Adapter implementation will consume this interface to compose applications, but an ear file is not itself a component. An ear file must not be supplied to the of(Path...) method.

Shaded (Uber-)Jar Archive

Maven provides the shade plugin for creating consolidated application archives (a.k.a. "uber-jar") that include all dependencies in a standalone format. While this format is useful for creating executable jars and other types of standalone Java applications, it breaks encapsulation and so is considered an anti-pattern for runtime-composable application components. An uber-jar must not be supplied to the of(Path...) method.

  • Method Details

    • of

      static IuComponent of(Path... path) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new component.
      Parameters:
      path - Path to the component archive, optionally followed by addition modular jar files if the component is a modular jar.
      Returns:
      component
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the jar is missing, unreadable, or invalid.

    • extend

      IuComponent extend(Path... modulePath)
      Creates a component that delegates to this component.

      A delegating component must:

      • Be loaded by an isolated class loader that delegates to this component's classLoader().
      • Include all of this component's interfaces, annotation types, and resources().
      • Delegate to a component whose kind is IuComponent.Kind.MODULAR_JAR or IuComponent.Kind.LEGACY_JAR.
      • Delegate to a modular component if the delegating component is modular.
      Parameters:
      modulePath - Paths to valid Module-defining jar files.
      Returns:
      delegating component

    • kind

      IuComponent.Kind kind()
      Gets the kind of component.
      Returns:
      IuComponent.Kind

    • name

      String name()
      Gets the component name.

      Returns the first non-null value of:

      1. Extension-Name manifest attribute
      2. artifactId POM property
      Returns:
      component name

    • version

      String version()
      Gets the component version.

      Returns the first non-null value of:

      1. Implementation-Version manifest attribute
      2. version POM property
      Returns:
      component version

    • classLoader

      ClassLoader classLoader()
      Gets the ClassLoader for this component.
      Returns:
      ClassLoader

    • interfaces

      Iterable<? extends IuType<?>> interfaces()
      Gets all of the component's public interfaces.

      This method is intended to support resource and service discovery of public APIs defined by the applications. Must not include interfaces from a standard Java or JEE module.

      Returns:
      interface facades
